title: Teacher ‘lunged at young boy with special needs then bit him’
text:
Tyler Mercier says his teacher lunged at him and bit him after he kicked her. The sixth-grader has special needs which cause him to lash out (Pictures: WRAL)

A teacher lunged at a young boy who has special needs and bit him, the child’s mother claims.

Tyler Mercier, 11, is said to have had his arm gnawed by the female teacher after a scuffle broke out at Westover Middle School in Fayetteville, North Carolina.

The youngster’s mother Deborah Glegola told WRAL: ‘He got frustrated with his work and the teacher.

‘He threw his book down and then a pencil, and then the pencil hit the teacher in the foot so the teacher decided to lunge at Tyler and then bit him.’

Tyler, who has a bite-like mark on his arm, said the teacher lashed out at him after he kicked her.

Last September, Tyler and his family hit the headlines after complaining that teaching assistants at Mary McArthur Elementary School had ‘roughed him up’ while trying to restrain hime.

He was home-school afterwards, with Glegola later deciding to return Tyler to school after being promised Westover staff would be able to deal with his outbursts.

Tyler’s mother Deborah Glegola is furious about what she says happened to her son, and is considering withdrawing him from school (Picture: WRAL)

She is now considering home-schooling Tyler again, and said: ‘I don’t think it’s okay for a teacher to bite a child.’

A school spokesman says the teacher is still in her job while it investigates the claims against her and decides whether any further action should be taken.
description: Tyler Mercier has an angry red wound on his hand which he claims was caused by his teacher biting him after he kicked her
